column4: any 1 know how 2 install vlc tar.gz file which is at my desktop.

you gotta be in the directory where the file is.

I dont quite understand what you mean
why do you go the hard route anyway? you could install vlc simply by typing: "sudo apt-get install vlc"

again, you'll get it by doing an update (sudo apt-get update) then installing it (sudo apt-get install emacs) if the package is named anything else than emacs, try to learn to use the search function (apt-cache search something). You can also join a "| grep somethingelse" to narrow your selection as in: "apt-cache search something | grep somethingelse"
then, use sudo apt-get install NameOfPackage
I dont understand your question. I dont know much about emacs but the package is available trough aptitude (apt-get)... you might wanna be more specific in your question?
np!
